intro: Rhipidostigma zollingeri, commonly known as the Zollinger's rock cress, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
